summary: This document is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding a draft cover letter related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It shows ongoing legal preparation and coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in October 2021.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender and recipient of the email discussing a draft cover letter related to the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the draft cover letter being discussed by prosecutors.

connections.description: The prosecutor is working on legal documents related to Maxwell's case.

events.title: Draft cover letter preparation
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a draft cover letter to a colleague for review and editing.

events.title: Cover letter draft review
events.description: Follow-up email with current draft of cover letter, indicating ongoing legal preparation.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively preparing legal documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell's case in October 2021.
The correspondence shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings or preparations nearly a year after Maxwell's arrest.
The email subject references a draft cover letter specifically mentioning Maxwell's name.
